overloads: a: any, b: lst -> is element a in list b?
a: any, b: any -> is str(b) in str(a)?

elements.name: Head | First Item
overloads: a: lst -> a[0]

elements.name: Number of Inputs
overloads: -> The number of inputs to the program

elements.name: Join On Newlines | Pad Binary to Mod 8 | Context if 1
overloads: a: lst -> a join on newlines
a: str -> a padded to a multiple of 8 with 0s
a: num -> a if a == 1 push context variable n

elements.name: Logarithm | Scan Fixpoint | Same Length? | Length Equals?
overloads: a: num, b: num -> log_b(a)
a: fun, b: any -> apply until a previous value is repeated, collecting intermediate results
a: str, b: str -> a same length as b
a: str, b: num -> len(a) == b

elements.name: Drop/Zero Slice From | Collect While Unique | Complex Number
overloads: a: num, b: num -> a.real + b.real * i
a: str|lst, b: num -> a[b:]
a: lst, b: lst[num] -> apl style drop
a: any, b: fun -> Apply b on a and collect unique values (until fixpoint). Does not include the initial value.

elements.name: Uppercase and lowercase
overloads: -> "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"

elements.name: Assign
overloads: a: lst, b: num, c: non-fun -> assign c to a at the index b / a[b] = c
a: lst, b: num, c: fun -> a[b] c= <stack items> (augmented assignment to list)
a: lst, b: lst, c: lst -> assign c to a at the indices in b
a: str, b: str, c: str -> replace regex matches of pattern b in string a with c
a: str, b: str, c: fun -> replace regex matches of pattern b in string a with the result of applying c to each match
a: str, b: fun, c: str -> replace regex matches of pattern c in string a with the result of applying b to each match
a: fun, b: str, c: str -> replace regex matches of pattern c in string b with the result of applying a to each match
a: rec, b: str, c: str -> a.b = c

elements.name: Replace
overloads: a: str, b: str, c: str -> replace all instances of b in a with c
a: fun, b: any, c: any -> reduce items in zip(b, c) by a

elements.name: Bitshift Left
overloads: a: num, b: num -> a << b
a: num, b: str -> b padded to length a with spaces prepended
a: str, b: num -> a padded to length b with spaces prepended
a: str, b: str -> a padded to length of b with spaces prepended

elements.name: Greater Than Or Equal To
overloads: a: num, b: num -> a >= b
a: str, b: num -> a >= str(b)
a: num, b: str -> str(a) >= b
a: str, b: str -> a >= b

elements.name: Factors | Is Numeric?
overloads: a: num -> Factors of a
a: str -> Is a numeric?

elements.name: Head Extract
overloads: a: lst|str -> Push a[0], then a[1:] onto the stack

elements.name: First Input
overloads: The first input to the program

elements.name: All Prime Exponents
overloads: a: num -> for all primes less than or equal to a, push the power of that prime in the factorisation of a

elements.name: Reduce by Function Object | Dyadic Range | Regex Match | Set Union
overloads: a: fun, b: any -> reduce iterable b by function a
a: any, b: fun -> reduce iterable a by function b
a: num, b: num -> the range [a, b)
a: str, b: num|str -> does regex pattern b match haystack a?
a: lst, b: lst -> union of a and b

elements.name: Phi
overloads: -> Literally just phi

elements.name: Duplicate
overloads: a -> a, a

elements.name: Sum
overloads: a: lst -> sum of a

elements.name: Cartesian Product Unsafe
overloads: a: list, b: list -> cartesian product of a and b in the standard order, but without accounting for infinite lists

elements.name: Swap
overloads: a, b -> b, a

elements.name: Modular | Matrix Multiply | Regex Full Match?
overloads: a: str|lst, b: num -> return every b-th element of a. If b is zero, mirror: prepend a to its reverse.
a: num, b: str|lst -> return every a-th element of b. If a is zero, mirror: append b to its reverse.
a: lst, b: lst -> a * b (matrix multiply)
a: str, b: str -> does the entirety of a match b?

elements.name: 1-Lift
overloads: a: lst -> each item of a multiplied by its 1-based index

elements.name: Surround
overloads: a: any, b: any -> a prepended and appended to b

elements.name: Last Extract | Tail Extract
overloads: a: lst|str -> Push a[:-1], a[-1] onto the stack

elements.name: All Inputs
overloads: A list of all inputs to the program

elements.name: Ord/Chr
overloads: a: str -> ord(a)
a: num -> chr(a)

elements.name: Reverse Stack
overloads: -> reverse the stack

elements.name: Unique Prime Factors | Case Of
overloads: a: num -> unique prime factors of a
a: str -> case of each character of a (uppercase = 1, lowercase = 0)

elements.name: Cartesian Power | Regex Search for Match
overloads: a: lst, b: num -> cart_prod([a] * n)
a: num, b: lst -> cart_prod([b] * n)
a: str, b: str -> return first index of pattern match b in target string a, -1 if not found
a: lst, b: str -> regex search vectorised
a: str|lst, b: lst -> push a, push cartesian product of b and b

elements.name: Product
overloads: a: lst -> product of a

elements.name: Compress String Using Dictionary
overloads: a: str -> compress a using the dictionary

elements.name: Grid Neighbours
overloads: a: lst[lst] -> Grid neighbours of a - right, down, left, up of a
a: lst[lst], b: num -> Grid neighbours of a - right, down, left, up of a and start from direction b => 0: right, 1: down, 2: left, 3: up. Negative b does not include middle, positive b does

elements.name: Square Root
overloads: a: num -> sqrt(a)

elements.name: Set Register
overloads: a: any -> register = a

elements.name: Triplicate
overloads: a -> [a, a, a]

elements.name: Greater Than
overloads: a: num, b: num -> a > b
a: str, b: num -> a > str(b)
a: num, b: str -> str(a) > b
a: str, b: str -> a > b

elements.name: Square | Pairs
overloads: a: num -> a ** 2
a: str -> a split into pairs

elements.name: Sort ascending
overloads: a: any -> convert to list and sort ascending

elements.name: Base-252 Compress String or Number
overloads: a: str -> compress a using base 252
a: num -> compress a using base 252

elements.name: Double
overloads: a: num -> a * 2
a: str -> a + a

elements.name: Zip
overloads: a: lst, b: lst -> zip a and b
a: lst, b: fun -> [[x, b(x)] for x in a]
a: fun, b: lst -> [[a(x), x] for x in b]

elements.name: Overlap | Overlapping Slices
overloads: a: lst, b: num -> Overlapping slices of a of length b
a: lst|str -> Overlapping slices of a of length 2

elements.name: Grid Neighbours (Wrap Around)
overloads: a: lst[lst] -> Grid neighbours of a - up, down, left, right - wrapping around

a: lst[lst], b: num -> Grid neighbours of a - right, down, left, up of a, wrapping around and start from direction b => 0: right, 1: down, 2: left, 3: up. Negative b does not include middle, positive b does

elements.name: Vectorised Sums | Integer Division
overloads: a: lst -> sum of each element of a
a: num, b: num -> a // b

elements.name: Inclusive zero Range | Is Lowercase
overloads: a: lst[num] -> apl-style iota from 0 to a
a: str -> is a lowercase?

elements.name: Stringify
overloads: a: any -> str(a)

elements.name: Multiplication
overloads: a: num, b: num -> a * b
a: num, b: str -> b repeated a times
a: str, b: num -> a repeated b times
a: str, b: str -> ring translate a according to b

modifiers.name: Lambda to Newline
modifiers.description:
Scan elements to the left until a newline is found. Push a
lambda with all of the scanned elements
overloads: <elements>ᵜ: Push a lambda

modifiers.name: Quadruple Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next four elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a lambda
overloads: Чfghi: Push the equivalent of λfghi} to the stack

modifiers.name: Dyadic Single Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next element (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a dyadic lambda
overloads: ᵈf: Push the equivalent of λ2|f} to the stack

modifiers.name: First Index Where
modifiers.description: Find the first index where an element is truthy
overloads: ᶤf: find the first index where f is truthy

modifiers.name: Parallel Apply and Wrap
modifiers.description:
Parallel apply two elements to the top of the stack
and wrap the result in a list

modifiers.name: Invariant Under? / Vertical Scan
modifiers.description: Check if a function is invariant under a transformation / vertical scan
overloads: ᵞf: check if top of stack is invariant under a transformation
ᵞf: scanl columns by f

modifiers.name: Key
modifiers.description: Map an element over the groups formed by identical items.
overloads: ᵏf: Map f over the groups formed by identical items

modifiers.name: Minimum By
modifiers.description: Minimum By Element
overloads: ᵐf: Minimum of top of stack based on results of f

modifiers.name: Apply Without Popping | Remove Duplicates by
modifiers.description:
Apply a 2+ arity element to the stack without popping
Remove duplicates from a list by an element
overloads: ᵇf<dyad|triad|tetrad>: apply f to the stack without popping
ᵇf<monad>: remove duplicates from a list by applying f to each pair of elements

modifiers.name: Apply To Head
modifiers.description: Apply element only to the head of list
overloads: ᴴf: Apply f to the head of the top of the stack

modifiers.name: Loop While Unique
modifiers.description: Loop While Unique - similar to ᶨ, but doesn't collect
overloads: ᶪf: Loop while unique

modifiers.name: Maximum By
modifiers.description: Maximum By Element
overloads: ᵐf: Maximum of top of stack based on results of f

modifiers.name: Sort By
modifiers.description: Sort By Element / Scanl
overloads: ᶳf: Sort top of stack based on results of f
ᶳf: Cumulatively reduce a list of items

modifiers.name: Dip
modifiers.description:
Stash the top of the stack temporarily, and then apply
the function. Finally, push the stashed value
overloads: ᵂf: pop M, apply f, push M

modifiers.name: Triple Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next three elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a lambda
overloads: эfgh: Push the equivalent of λfgh} to the stack

modifiers.name: Map Over Prefixes
modifiers.description: Map an element over the prefixes of a list
overloads: ᵖf: Map f over prefixes

modifiers.name: Double Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next two elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a lambda
overloads: ϩfg: Push the equivalent of λfg} to the stack

modifiers.name: Loop and Collect While Unique
modifiers.description: Loop and Collect While Unique
overloads: ᶨf: Loop and collect while unique

modifiers.name: Collect Until No Change / Neighbours All Equal?
modifiers.description:
Run func on the prev result until the result no longer changes
returning all intermediate results
Given a dyadic function, apply the function to all overlapping pairs of elements
and test if all results are equal
overloads: ᵘf: Collect until no change

modifiers.name: Apply to Neighbours | Number of Truthy Elements
modifiers.description:
To each overlapping pair, reduce it by an element
Apply a dyadic element for all pairs of neighboring elements.
Count the number of truthy elements in a list under a mondaic element
overloads: ȧf<monad>: Count how many items in a list are truthy after applying f to each
ᵃf<dyad>: equivalent to pushing the function, then calling ȧ

modifiers.name: Zip With / Reject by
modifiers.description:
Given a dyadic function, zip two lists and reduce each by f
 and then check if all results are equal.
Given a monadic function, the inverse of monadic /.
Filters where the function is falsey

modifiers.name: Conditional Execution
modifiers.description: Pop the top of the stack, and, if it's truthy, apply a function

modifiers.name: Dyadic Double Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next two elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a dyadic lambda
overloads: ᵉfg: Push the equivalent of λ2|fg} to the stack

modifiers.name: Apply to Register
modifiers.description:
Apply a function to the register. Essentially, push
the register value to the stack, apply the function, and
then pop back into the register
overloads: ᴿf: Apply f to the register

modifiers.name: Dyadic Quadruple Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next four elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a dyadic lambda
overloads: ᵍfghi: Push the equivalent of λ2|fghi} to the stack

modifiers.name: Single Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next element (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a lambda
overloads: ⸠f: Push the equivalent of λf} to the stack

modifiers.name: Map as Stacks
modifiers.description:
Map a function over the top of the stack, treating each iteration
as if it were a stack of items. Essentially, dump before mapping

modifiers.name: Vectorise
modifiers.description: Vectorises
overloads: ᵛf: f but vectorised

modifiers.name: Reduce Columns | Map Over Suffixes
modifiers.description:
Reduce columns of a 2d list by a function
Map an element over suffixes

modifiers.name: Dyadic Triple Element Lambda
modifiers.description: Turn the next three elements (whether that be a structure/modifier/element) into a dyadic lambda
overloads: ᶠfgh: Push the equivalent of λ2|fgh} to the stack

modifiers.name: Outer Product | Table
modifiers.description: Outer product
overloads: ᵒf: Pop two lists, then make a matrix from them by applying f to each pair of elements

modifiers.name: Foldl | Reduce By | Filter by
modifiers.description: Reduce a list by an element
overloads: /f: reduce by element f

modifiers.name: Parallel Apply
modifiers.description: Parallel apply two elements to the top of the stack

modifiers.name: Scan Fixed Point
modifiers.description: Scan a function until it reaches a fixed point
overloads: ᵡf: scan f until a fixed point is reached / apply until a previous value is repeated, collecting intermediate results

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 8

syntax.name: Retrieve Original Element
syntax.description: Call the original, vyxal defined, meaning of an element. Useful for when you want to define a new element with the same name as a built-in one

syntax.name: Open Map Lambda
syntax.description: Open a lambda that automatically maps its function to the top of the stack

syntax.name: String Digraphs
syntax.description: Used for string-related digraphs

syntax.name: Open Decision Problem Structure
syntax.description: Open a decision problem structure. Returns whether an iterable has any items that match a predicate

syntax.name: Close Two Structures
syntax.description: Match and close two open structures.

syntax.name: Record Definition
syntax.description: Define a record with members

syntax.name: Base-252 Compressed String
syntax.description: Decompress and push a string, converted from a bijective base 252 number using the codepage

syntax.name: One Character String
syntax.description: Push the next character as a string

syntax.name: Ternary Statement
syntax.description: Open a ternary statement. Pop condition, if truthy, run <ontrue>, else run <onfalse>

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 2

syntax.name: Defined Element Call
syntax.description: Call a defined element

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 3

syntax.name: Comment
syntax.description: Comment out the rest of the line

syntax.name: List Digraphs
syntax.description: Used for list-related digraphs

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 4

syntax.name: Close A Structure
syntax.description: Match and close the nearest open structure.

syntax.name: Augmented Assignment
syntax.description: Apply a function to a variable value and store the result in the same variable.

syntax.name: Decimal Separator
syntax.description: Used to separate the integer and fractional parts of a number

syntax.name: Close All Structures
syntax.description: Match and close all open structures.

syntax.name: Base-252 Compressed Number
syntax.description: Decompress and push a number, converted from a bijective base 252 number using the codepage

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 9

syntax.name: Context Paramter Index
syntax.description: Index into the list of context parameters.

syntax.name: Open Filter Lambda
syntax.description: Open a lambda that automatically filters the top of the stack by its function

syntax.name: Open Reduce/Accumulate Lambda
syntax.description: Open a lambda that automatically reduces/accumulates the top of the stack by its function

syntax.name: Close List
syntax.description: Close a list. Pushes the list to the stack when closed.

syntax.name: Generator Structure
syntax.description: Open a generator structure. Allows for generator expressions

syntax.name: Retrieve Variable
syntax.description: Push the value of a variable.

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 5

syntax.name: Structure Branch
syntax.description: Delimit the next section in a structure.

syntax.name: Two Character String
syntax.description: Push the next two characters as a string

syntax.name: Assign Variable
syntax.description: Assign a variable to a value.

syntax.name: Open/Close String
syntax.description: Open/close a string. If the string is closed, push it to the stack. Closes all string types

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 6

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 1

syntax.name: Open Sort Lambda
syntax.description: Open a lambda that automatically sorts the top of the stack by its function

syntax.name: Open List
syntax.description: Open a list. Pushes the list to the stack when closed.

syntax.name: Element/Modifier Definition
syntax.description: Define a custom element/modifier that can be used in programs

syntax.name: Miscellaneous Digraphs
syntax.description: Used for miscellaneous digraphs

syntax.name: If/Elif/Else Statement
syntax.description: Open an if statement. Allows for if/elif/else statements

syntax.name: While Loop
syntax.description: Open a while loop. While the top of the stack is truthy, execute code.

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 0

syntax.name: Extension Method
syntax.description: Define an overload on a custom element based on types. Requires at least one type to be specified.

syntax.name: Dictionary Compressed String
syntax.description: Decompress and push a string using SSS compression, shamelessly stolen from Jelly

syntax.name: For Loop
syntax.description: Open a for loop. For each item in the top of the stack, execute code, storing loop variable.

syntax.name: Numeric Literal
syntax.description: The number 7

syntax.name: Variable Unpacking
syntax.description: Unpack the top of the stack into a list of variables.

syntax.name: Mathematical Digraphs
syntax.description: Used for math-related digraphs

syntax.name: Imaginary Number
syntax.description: Used to represent the imaginary unit

syntax.name: Constant Digraphs
syntax.description: Used for constant-related digraphs

syntax.name: Two Byte Number
syntax.description: Push the next two bytes as a number, converted from bijective base 255 using the codepage

syntax.name: Open Lambda
syntax.description: Open a lambda.

syntax.name: Defined Modifier Call
syntax.description: Call a defined modifier
